name: THE PRE-MODERN WORLD
description: Prerequisite: HUM 101 and HUM 102 with a grade of C or better. Case studies focus on differing forms of material culture, belief systems, aesthetic norms, and artistic productions to develop an understanding of ancient and medieval world views. This course satisfies three credits of the GUR in Cultural History.

name: THE MAKING OF THE MODERN WORLD
description: Prerequisite: HUM 101 and HUM 102with a grade of C or better. Uses case studies to examine such key processes as the expansion of global trade and the formation of a global economy, European perceptions of non-Western cultures, and the roots and legacy of imperialism. This course satisfies 3 credits of the Cultural History GUR. Honors Note: See HUM 101.

name: ETHICAL ISSUES BUSINESS
description: Prerequisite: HUM 101 with a grade of C or better. An examination of the ethical problems and moral foundations of business from the perspective of moral philosophy. Among the questions explored are: What are the rights of employees and employers in the workplace? Do corporations and managers have an obligation to society at large? What is the relationship between personal and business morality? Is there a moral justification for the free market?

name: INDEPENDENT STUDY
description: at SISConnxService.getCourseListing(String ticket, String term, String subjectID) in d:\asp.net\ConnxWebService\App_Code\SISConnxService.cs:line 766
